wikipedia_page.main:
Michael Edwin Akam FRS (born 19 June 1952, in Bromley, Kent) is a British zoologist. He is professorial fellow of Darwin College, Cambridge, and he is a director, University Museum of Zoology.He was Damon Runyan fellow at Stanford University, from 1979 to 1981.
He is American Association for the Advancement of Science fellow.

response: The concept of homeotic selectors was further elaborated or at least qualified by Michael Akam in a so-called "post-selector gene" model that incorporated additional findings and "walked back" the "orthodoxy" of selector-dependent stable binary switches.
This has been proposed to correspond more closely to the interpretation of animal homeotics outlined by Michael Akam.
*2009: Peter Shaw Ashton and Michael Akam
